users.usage_notes: Central table for all customer data. All orders and transactions reference this table.

columns.name: email
columns.desc: Unique identifier for customer login and communications

columns.name: created_at
columns.desc: Account creation date. Use for customer lifetime value and cohort analysis

business_rules: Email must be unique across all users

orders.usage_notes: Always join with users table for customer information. Filter by status for different reports.

columns.name: user_id
columns.desc: References the customer who placed this order. Join with users table.

columns.name: status
columns.desc: Order state: 'pending' (awaiting payment), 'completed' (shipped and paid), 'cancelled' (refunded or void)

columns.name: total_price
columns.desc: Final order amount including tax and discounts. Use for revenue calculations.

columns.name: order_date
columns.desc: When the order was placed. Use for time-series analysis and trend reports.

business_rules: Only orders with status='completed' should be included in revenue reports
Cancelled orders should be excluded from sales metrics but included in cancellation analysis
Pending orders older than 7 days are automatically cancelled
common_queries: Total revenue: SELECT SUM(total_price) FROM orders WHERE status='completed'
Customer orders: SELECT u.name, COUNT(o.id) FROM users u JOIN orders o ON u.id = o.user_id GROUP BY u.id
